result.execSummary:
This case is being appealed. If the court makes a decision in a case that a party disagrees with, the party may have the right to seek review by a higher court to determine if the trial court's decision was correct. Appeals are most often made after a trial or final decision in a case, but an appeal can also occur before a final decision.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Hilary Edwards.  The DE enters a plea of guilty to ct. 1, found guilty.  $100.00 fine + costs, 30 days to pay or 4 days jail or work crew.  Ct. 2 was dismissed at an earlier hearing.  DNA p/w given to the DE. Court #1 - photo of knife

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Hilary Edwards.  Arguments heard on State's motion to reopen evidence.  Court grants the State's motion to reopen evidence.  Testimony taken from KPD T. Groth.  Argument heard by the State.  Atty Hilary Edwards wishes to file a brief.  Defense brief due 10/30/15.  Court will issue a written decision on the suppression motion.  Arguments heard on whether to dismiss count 2.  Court dismisses counts 2 on failure of probable cause.  JS to remain on for 11/9/15 @ 9am re: count 1

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Hilary Edwards.  Testimony commences - P.O. Alex Wicketts & Larry Bunch.  No further evidence by either side.  Defense moves for admission of her two exhibits; granted by the court.  Court takes the suppression motion and the constitutionality motion under advisement.  Parties may file supplemental briefs, but are not required.   If attys wish to file any briefs, the defense brief will be due w/in 20 days, State will have 10 days thereafter to respond.  Court will issue written decision.  FPT set for 10/22/15 @ 9:30am, JS 11/9/15 @ 9am.

2:17  Special Prosecutor Attorney Jerrold Hinshaw appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person. Clerk LE.    Def. is referred to the Public Defender.  If not eligible, def. to retain his own counsel. Court date will not be adjourned due to def.'s failure to retain counsel. Initial appearance adjourned to 6-9-15 @ 1:00 pm, atty status.  Time limits tolled by court based on def's request. $2500.00 Signature Bond set.
